content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: BWDTC
      operator: non_empty
    - name: BWTESTCD
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value:
        - USUBJID
        - BWDTC
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.SEND142
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when there is more than one record present for any particular
  Body Weight test, in the BW Domain, for a subject on a particular date.
#The check for this rule was revised to NOT check the records where BWDTC is null
Outcome:
  Message: The Body Weight test is not unique for this subject and date/time.
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
    - BWTESTCD
    - BWDTC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Domain
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.0'
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '142'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
      #need to determine what can be done with catalog version 5 if anything
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: One record per test per observation time per subject,
                  Tabulation.
    #SMEs do we want to keep "Tabulation" for any reason?
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.1
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '142'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
      #need to determine what can be done with catalog version 5 if anything
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: One record per test per observation time per subject,
                  Tabulation.
    #SMEs do we want to keep "Tabulation" for any reason?
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.1
      - Name: SENDIG-DART
        Version: v1.1
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '142'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
      #need to determine what can be done with catalog version 5 if anything
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: One record per test per observation time per subject,
                  Tabulation.
    #SMEs do we want to keep "Tabulation" for any reason?
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.1
      - Name: SENDIG-DART
        Version: v1.2
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '142'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
      #need to determine what can be done with catalog version 5 if anything
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: One record per test per observation time per subject,
                  Tabulation.
    #SMEs do we want to keep "Tabulation" for any reason?
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.1
      - Name: SENDID-GENETOX
        Version: v1.0
              #double check the last few
        References:
          - Origin: SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '142'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4'
      #need to determine what can be done with catalog version 5 if anything
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: One record per test per observation time per subject,
                  Tabulation.
    #SMEs do we want to keep "Tabulation" for any reason?
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - BW
